title: Open Source
description: A market-driving Open Source software, combining components and standard architectures to enable the connection to IoT with Context Information Management and Big Data services in the Cloud.

title: Smart Usage of Data
description: Interoperability is guaranteed through the utilization of the data models de facto standardized in our Smart Data Models program in combination with Standard APIs for data management and exchange.

title: Smart Solutions & Services
description: The entire value chain is taken into account, allowing for seamless plug-and-play integration with third-party solutions and services.

title: FIWARE Ecosystem
description: Consisting of more than 350 cities, 40 iHubs, a FIWARE Accelerator Programme, and strategic partnerships with GSMA, TM Forum, IUDX, Alastria, and ETSI, amongst others.

title: Becoming Truly Smart
description: The FIWARE Reference Architecture for Smart Cities eliminates vertical silos by establishing a Context Information Management layer that offers a comprehensive overview of city activities. By sharing city data publicly and integrating data from various sectors, city governance systems can be improved.

title: Unleashing Right-Time Open Data
description: Third-party solution providers can benefit from real-time open data published by the city and made available through standard APIs. They can then sell their solutions to cities worldwide, targeting a larger market and boosting business.

title: Common Information Models
description: Thanks to 'de facto' standard information models, achieving full interoperability among different city systems incurs no costs and enables system portability across various sectors and cities.

title: Thriving Data Economy
description: Once data is made publicly accessible and exchangeable, city administrators can offer higher-value services to citizens, improving public service delivery and benefiting cities, private businesses, and citizens.
